{"step_by_step_thinking": "Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is a highly vascular tumor that primarily affects adolescent males. According to the documents, the tumor originates from the sphenopalatine foramen and is associated with various symptoms including nasal obstruction and epistaxis. The documents also mention that the tumor is primarily supplied by the internal maxillary artery. Therefore, the main vessel involved in bleeding from Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma would be the internal maxillary artery.", "answer_choice": "C. Internal maxillary aery"}
